tool.name: RNA-Seq sr human master v0.2 plus tcr Optimized Workflow
tool.version: SAMTOOLS: 1.2; BWA: 0.7.12; PICARD: 1.134; JAVA: 1.8.0; TOPHAT: 1.4.1; SALMON: 0.8.2; MIXCR: 2.0.2
tool.command:
BRI_RNASEQ_sr_human_master_v0.2_plus_tcr_04252016.py --sample-name $sample --lane1 $input_lane_1 --lane2 $input_lane_2 --lane3 $input_lane_3 --lane4 $input_lane_4 --lane5 $input_lane_5 --lane6 $input_lane_6 --lane7 $input_lane_7 --lane8 $input_lane_8
##use precomputed indexes --tophat-ref "${tophat_index.fields.path}" --picard-ref "${picard_index.fields.path}" --salmon-ref "${salmon_index.fields.path}" --samtools-ref "${samtools_index.fields.path}" --mixcr-ref $mixcr_ref
## annotation ref files --gtf $gtf_file --refflat-file $refflat_file --ribosomal-file $ribosomal_list --adapters-file $adapaters_file --annotation-snp-bed $annotation_snp_bed
## parameters --tophat-library-type $tophat_lib_type --salmon-strandedness $salmon_strandedness --picard-strand-type $picard_strand_type --htseq-strand-type $htseq_strand_type
## output vcf file --output-fastqmcf-log $output_fastqmcf_log ## --output-tophat-bam $output_tophat_bam --output-trinity-transcripts $output_trinity_transcripts --output-trinity-log $output_trinity_log ## --output-mixcr-reports $output_mixcr_reports ## --output-mixcr-clones $output_mixcr_clones ## --output-mixcr-alignment $output_mixcr_alignments ## --output-salmon-quantification $output_salmon_quantification ## --output-salmon-gene-quantification $output_salmon_gene_quantification ## --output-picard-markDuplicates-html $output_picard_markDuplicates_html --output-picard-markDuplicates-directory $output_picard_markDuplicates_html.extra_files_path --output-picard-markDuplicates-bam $output_picard_markDuplicates_bam --output-picard-alignmentSummary $output_picard_alignmentSummary --output-picard-alignmentSummary-directory $output_picard_alignmentSummary.extra_files_path --output-picard-collectRnaSeqSummary $output_picard_collectRnaSeqSummary --output-picard-collectRnaSeqSummary-directory $output_picard_collectRnaSeqSummary.extra_files_path --output-tophatStats $output_tophatStats --output-htseq-counts $output_htseqcount_no_dups_counts --output-htseq-counts2 $output_htseqcount2_dups_counts ## --output-htseq-log2 $output_htseqcount2_dups_log ## --output-fastqc-html $output_fastqc_html --output-fastqc-text $output_fastqc_text --output-bcf1 $output_mpileup1 ## --output-bcf2 $output_mpileup2 ## --output-log $output_log
## globus parameters ##--username $username ##--goauth-token "$goauth" ##--source-ep=$from_endpoint ##--destination-ep="$to_endpoint" ##--destination-dir="$to_dir" ##--deadline=1200 > $output_log

param.label: Select a Tophat reference genome
param.name: tophat_index

param.help: Should be the similar to the reference genome chosen for Tophat
param.label: Select a Picard built-in reference genome
param.name: picard_index
salmon_index
param.label: Select Salmon reference transcriptome
param.help: If your transcriptome of interest is not listed, contact your Galaxy admin

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

param.label: Location of rRNA sequences in genome, in interval_list format
param.name: ribosomal_list

param.help: TopHat will treat the reads as strand specific. Every read alignment will have an XS attribute tag. Consider supplying library type options below to select the correct RNA-seq protocol.
param.label: Tophat Library Type
param.name: tophat_lib_type
salmon_strandedness
param.label: Specify the strandedness of the reads for Salmon
param.option: read 1 (or single-end read) comes from the forward strand (SF)
read 1 (or single-end read) comes from the reverse strand (SR)

param.help: STRAND_SPECIFICITY; For unpaired reads, use FIRST_READ_TRANSCRIPTION_STRAND if the reads are expected to be on the transcription strand.
param.label: What is the RNA-seq library strand specificity for PICARD
param.name: picard_strand_type

param.label: Strandedness for HTSEQ-Count
param.name: htseq_strand_type
param.help: Specify whether the data is from a strand-specific assay. 'Reverse' means yes with reversed strand interpretation.
